tracks.title: Visions
tracks.voice_instruct: A deep, commanding male bass-baritone with gravelly warmth, like a war-weary general finding redemption, powerful low register with occasional breaks into desperate intensity
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, ethereal prog rock with rising chromatic stormwall motif as vision trigger on ascending half-step string run, Honor's Theme hymn-like melody as the Almighty's voice on choir unison over organ, sweeping orchestral dynamics, dramatic male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, dreamlike sequences breaking into heavy riffs
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The storm takes me, I'm standing somewhere else,
A world of spren and stone and ancient bells,
Knights Radiant in armor, silver-white,
They hold the line against eternal night.

[verse 2]
But then they break, they lay their blades on stone,
Ten thousand Shardblades screaming as they're thrown,
The Recreance, the day that honor died,
And I am left here, weeping, terrified.

[chorus]
Visions in the highstorm, visions in the rain,
The Almighty speaks but no one hears His pain,
"Unite them, Dalinar, before the end,"
The world is breaking, and it needs to mend.

[bridge]
The stormwall rises, ancient, climbing high,
A chromatic scream against the sky,
And in its peak I see what must be done,
But when I wake, I stand alone at dawn.

[verse 3]
Sadeas whispers, "Dalinar's gone mad,"
The highprinces laugh at all the visions I have had,
But I have seen the end of everything,
And I will be the fool who tries to bring
Them together, storms, I'll drag them whole,
A united Alethkar, or ashes in a hole.

[outro]
The vision fades, the highstorm passes by,
But the voice still echoes: "Unite, or die."

tracks.title: The Codes
tracks.voice_instruct: A deep, commanding male bass-baritone with gravelly warmth, like a war-weary general finding redemption, powerful low register with occasional breaks into desperate intensity
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, military march building to epic battle sequence, Honor's Theme hymn-like major key melody on clean guitar arpeggio during code-reading, distorted industrial Thrill riff erupting at the Tower betrayal, orchestral arrangements with brass fanfares, dramatic male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, betrayal climax
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I wear the uniform, I keep the codes,
The ancient laws that mark a soldier's roads,
No wine on duty, armor always on,
I am the man who leads by what he's drawn.

[verse 2]
A joint assault, Sadeas and I will ride,
Together to the Tower, side by side,
He swears it on his Blade, he swears it true,
And I believe, because that's what I do.

[chorus]
The codes demand we stand for something more,
Than gemhearts bleeding on the canyon floor,
"Unite them," said the voice from ancient days,
And I will lead, though I am lost in maze.

[bridge]
But Sadeas pulls back, the bridges turn away,
He leaves us on the Tower, leaves us there to stay,
And die. The Thrill erupts, the blood runs hot,
And honor is the only thing I've got.

[verse 3]
My men are falling, arrows in the rain,
The Parshendi surging, screaming, and the pain,
I lift my Blade and stand upon the edge,
A Blackthorn's final, desperate pledge.

[outro]
A bridge comes running, carried by the damned,
And Kaladin, a bridgeman, takes his stand.

tracks.title: The Duelist
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, youthful male tenor with swagger and charm, confident delivery with flashes of sincerity, like a young prince who is more thoughtful than he appears
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, energetic arena rock with flashy guitar solos, no recurring motifs yet for Adolin, driving rhythm section, confident male vocals with swagger, brass stabs, crowd-roar sound design, concept album continuity, theatrical, character introduction
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Shardplate, Shardblade, born into the fight,
A Kholin prince who burns a little bright,
Father reads his book and walks the codes,
But I was made for dueling, made for roads.

[verse 2]
The arena cheers, the crowd demands a show,
I dance with steel and lay the challengers low,
Each Shard I win, a step toward the plan,
To prove my father right, to prove the man.

[chorus]
I am the duelist, I am the blade,
Fashionably lethal, never afraid,
But when the fighting's done and silence falls,
I hear my father's honor through the walls.

[bridge]
Renarin watches from behind his books,
My brother, fragile, gets the pitying looks,
But I would break the world for him, you know,
He's stronger than the Shards will ever show.

[verse 3]
They say my father's mad, they say he's done,
But every man who says it answers to his son,
I'll win the duels, I'll win the Shards, I'll win,
Until the world sees what I see in him.

[outro]
The duelist salutes, the crowd roars on,
But the real fight hasn't even begun.

tracks.title: Fashion and Fury
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, youthful male tenor with swagger and charm, confident delivery with flashes of sincerity, like a young prince who is more thoughtful than he appears
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, high-energy arena rock with distorted industrial Thrill riff temptation in arena, glitched percussion heartbeat during battle, driving drums and dual guitar harmonies, energetic male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, four-on-one duel sequence
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
New boots, new cape, I dress to win the room,
Before I win the duel, before the bloom
Of Stormlight on my Plate, the crack of glass,
I make them watch, I make the moment last.

[verse 2]
But four on one, they've rigged the bracket wide,
Sadeas's friends, they want my father's hide,
They circle me, they think they'll break me down,
The Thrill, that hunger, wants to paint the town.

[chorus]
Fashion and fury, silk and steel,
I'll show them what a Kholin heart can feel,
The blood is singing, red mist in my eyes,
The Thrill says, "Let them fall, let none survive."

[bridge]
No. No, I'm better than the rage inside,
I fight with honor, I fight with pride,
The arena's not a slaughterhouse, it's art,
And I will master every single part.

[verse 3]
Kaladin leaps into the ring, a slave,
A bridgeman standing where no bridgemen brave,
Together, back to back, we hold the line,
And something shifts, a partnership, a sign.

[outro]
The Thrill retreats, the duel is won with grace,
A prince and bridgeman, standing face to face.

tracks.title: Patterns
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, youthful male tenor with swagger and charm alternating with a witty, bright female soprano, romantic duet energy with playful banter
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, romantic acoustic rock with quiet Honor's Theme hymn-like major key melody as love theme variation on clean guitar arpeggio over organ, gentle strings, playful rhythm section, male-female vocal interplay, concept album continuity, theatrical, courtship duet
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
She steps off the carriage, red hair in the wind,
A wit so sharp it cuts before it's pinned,
I was expecting someone meek and small,
Instead she makes me trip before I fall.

[verse 2]
Her drawings catch the world in ink and light,
Her lies are almost prettier than right,
A spren of fractals buzzes at her side,
"Mmm, truth," it hums, and Shallan tries to hide.

[chorus]
Patterns in the fabric, patterns in the stone,
Patterns in the way she makes me feel less alone,
Every conversation is a duel of wit,
And I am losing, and I love every bit.

[bridge]
A hymn plays somewhere, soft, in major key,
The honor of a promise, you and me,
Not oaths of war or codes of ancient days,
Just, "Let me walk beside you through the haze."

[verse 3]
Father would approve, he's said as much,
A Kholin and a Davar, a strategic touch,
But I don't care about the politics,
I care about the way her laughter sticks.

[outro]
Patterns, patterns, everywhere they bloom,
Love starts quiet in a war camp's gloom.

tracks.title: The Chasms
tracks.voice_instruct: A female soprano and male baritone alternating, tense and reluctant cooperation building to mutual respect, raw acoustic delivery in a confined space
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, claustrophobic acoustic rock building to chasmfiend battle, approaching rising chromatic stormwall motif for the storm in chasms, brief distorted industrial Thrill riff for chasmfiend attack, echoing vocals as if in a canyon, concept album continuity, theatrical, duet of enemies becoming allies
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Down in the chasms where the dead men fall,
Where rotspren gather on the chasm wall,
A lighteyes and a bridgeman, forced to share
The darkness, and the weight of what we bear.

[verse 2]
He hates me for my station, for my name,
I hate him for his anger, for his blame,
But something's moving in the deeper dark,
A chasmfiend hunting, drawn to our small spark.

[chorus]
Down in the chasms, stripped of rank and pride,
Two broken people, standing side by side,
The storm is coming, water's going to rise,
And all that matters is we both survive.

[bridge]
The Thrill, a heartbeat in the monster's chest,
It charges and we give it all our best,
He holds the spear, I draw the Pattern's light,
Two strangers learning how to trust and fight.

[verse 3]
He tells me about Tien, I tell him lies,
We trade our broken pieces, compromise,
The water rises, and we climb the wall,
And for one moment, neither of us falls.

[outro]
The chasms keep our secrets, dark and deep,
Two people, cracked, but learning how to leap.

tracks.title: Soulcaster
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, theatrical female soprano with an undercurrent of darkness, witty delivery that cracks into raw emotion, versatile between playful and devastating
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, psychedelic prog rock with Shadesmar inverted stormwall motif on reversed strings, ethereal synth layers, otherworldly vocal effects, dramatic female vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, first Shadesmar sequence
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The bead of glass, I hold it in my hand,
"What are you?" and it answers, "I am sand,"
I breathe and something shifts behind the veil,
A sea of beads, a dark and endless trail.

[verse 2]
Shadesmar, the realm of thought and spren,
A sky of blackness, ocean without end,
Each bead a soul of something in our world,
And I am standing here, my power unfurled.

[chorus]
Soulcaster, they will call me,
Radiant, if I dare to see
The truth of what I am, of what I've done,
A girl who breaks the world and calls it fun.

[bridge]
The storm is different here, inverted, wrong,
A stormwall rising where it don't belong,
But I can feel the power in my bones,
I reshape matter, I remake the stones.

[verse 3]
Pattern whispers, "Truth, Shallan, truth,"
But every truth I've buried since my youth,
Is sharper than a Shardblade, cuts more deep,
And I'm not ready, not ready for that leap.

[outro]
The Soulcaster has no fabrial, no stone,
The power lives in Shallan, and Shallan alone.

tracks.title: The Wretch
tracks.voice_instruct: A raw, emotionally intense male baritone hollowed out by depression, barely above a whisper in verses, the vocal equivalent of a man drowning, with brief eruptions of bitter anger
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, sparse and minimal arrangement, brief distorted industrial Thrill riff eruption of rage, deliberate absence of Honor's Theme, hollow drums, isolated vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, depression personified in music
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The men are training, learning how to fight,
Rock makes stew, and Teft calls out at night,
But I am sinking, I am going down,
Into a darkness thick enough to drown.

[verse 2]
I nearly let him die, the lighteyes lord,
I had the spear, I had the bridgeman's cord,
But something in me whispered, "Let him fall,
He'd let you die, he wouldn't care at all."

[chorus]
The wretch, the wretch, he lives inside my skin,
He pulls me under when the light grows thin,
No stormlight, no Syl, no gleam, no hope,
Just a bridgeman hanging by a fraying rope.

[bridge]
Where's the hymn? Where's the melody?
The honor and the purpose that once lived in me?
The silence is a chasm deeper than the Plains,
And I am falling through it, through the rain.

[verse 3]
Syl is fading, I can barely see her glow,
She asks me, "What's wrong?" and I don't know,
Or maybe I do, maybe that's the worst,
I know exactly where the darkness nursed.

[outro]
The wretch lies down, the bridgeman carries on,
But the light inside him might already be gone.
